intro: Androsace adfinis var. brigantiaca, commonly known as the Alpine sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are usually succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to survive in harsh alpine conditions. This variety is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
